title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" and pertains to conveyance vessels. The "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" allows the Secretary of Transportation to convey certain vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. Before conveying a vessel, the organization must agree to sell it for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused funds to the United States. Amounts returned will be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The Secretary will deliver the vessel at its current location upon approval of the conveyance. The Operations Revolving Fund was created in 1951. The Secretary must deliver vessels conveyed under this section at their current location and condition without cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official or registration numbers, such as DIXIE, ELISSA, EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, and LIBBY ROSE. The vessels listed by their official or registration numbers include ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, and RBOAT. The vessels listed by their official or registration numbers include PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, SWELL DANCER, TESSA, TOP DUCK, VIKING, and WHIT CON TIKI. Foreign-flag vessel H851 may engage in coastwise trade. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsements. Additionally, a certificate of documentation may be issued for the vessel WHIT CON TIKI to engage in coastwise trade. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL (Panama official number 8356-PEXT-2) under certain conditions, including a major conversion in a US shipyard and the construction of an additional vessel within a specified timeframe. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with coastwise and fishery endorsements for vessels under specific conditions, including construction in a US shipyard and delivery within a set timeframe. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with fishery endorsements for specific vessels, including the DA WARRIOR. The vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC can be sold to non-US citizens and transferred to a foreign registry. The vessel AMY CHOUEST is considered less than 500 gross tons for US maritime laws. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Physical Ocean Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
